resources.string: Go to Official Exam Board Website
Adjust focus areas anytime from Plan Settings after onboarding completes.
Your weekly plan will have %1$d tasks/day (est.)
You completed 6 months of preparation. Now it\'s time for practice exams!
You started the final month of practice exam camp!
You solved a total of 10 full practice exams!
Don\'t forget to complete today\'s goals.
today is the last day for applications!
Life gets busy, and that\'s totally okay. But we know you can do this. How about just 10 minutes today?
You\'ve come so far already. Missing a few days doesn\'t erase your progress. Ready to jump back in?
It\'s never too late to restart. Even small steps count. What\'s one task you could tackle today?
Your future self will thank you for getting back on track. No pressure‚Äîjust one task at a time.
We believe in you, and we\'re here to help whenever you\'re ready. Let\'s make today count.
You have 3 months to prepare! This is the perfect time to build a strong foundation. Focus on grammar basics and vocabulary building.
Two months left! You\'re in the intermediate phase. Time to practice reading comprehension and strengthen your weak areas.
One month remaining! Enter the advanced phase. Focus on full practice tests and time management strategies.
Final two weeks! Review your mistakes, perfect your timing, and stay confident. You\'ve prepared well.
One week left! Focus on light review and rest. Trust your preparation. Stay calm and confident.
Important countdown reminders at key preparation milestones
Check back later for new exam announcements from √ñSYM
Bring your ID and exam document
Ready to plan your study session
Red Book - Essential Grammar in Use
Blue Book - English Grammar in Use
Green Book - Advanced Grammar in Use
Complete at least 10 tasks in each YDS category
Solve the exercises in the book for the topics you studied to reinforce them.
Read at least 3 news articles from Newsinlevels.com (Level 1-2) and extract 15 new words.
Listen to a podcast from ESL/British Council and review the words you learned.
Review all the new words (approximately 40-50 words) you learned this week using a flashcard app.
Watch a series episode or movie with English subtitles. Focus on filling your ears, not understanding.
Quickly review all grammar topics covered this week. Note down anything you don\'t understand.
Watch an English YouTube channel or read a blog about a topic that interests you.
Today is the last day for %s applications!
Solve a 40-50 question practice exam (Time: 60-75 min). Pay attention to reading, grammar and vocabulary focus.
2. Lesson: Exam Analysis and Vocabulary Study
Thoroughly analyze all your mistakes and blanks. Note down unknown words and add them to your vocabulary set.
Source: %1$s. Study in detail on this week\'s topic \'%2$s\'.
%1$s book exercises on yesterday\'s topic. Complete all without skipping.
Do translation or sentence construction exercises using the grammar structures you learned.
Reinforce this week\'s grammar topic and solve additional exercises.
Solve at least 20 questions from the %1$s question type.
Review all grammar topics and rules covered this week.
Briefly review next week\'s topic \'%1$s\' to prepare in advance.
Make a general assessment of the week. Identify your strengths and weaknesses.
Source: A recent YDS/Y√ñKDƒ∞L exam from past years. Solve all 80 questions in exactly 180 minutes.
Take at least 1 hour break after the exam. Then thoroughly analyze your wrong answers, blanks, and correct answers you weren\'t confident about. List unknown words.
Source: A practice exam from a reliable publisher. Solve all 80 questions in exactly 180 minutes.
Perform detailed analysis like yesterday. Focus especially on recurring error types.
Source: A past exam. Solve all 80 questions in exactly 180 minutes.
Analyze your results and review new words you learned in this practice exam.
Review all unknown words from this week\'s practice exams using a flashcard app.
Review general error patterns from this week\'s practice exams (e.g., time management, specific question types).
Determine next week\'s strategy and relax your mind. The exam is coming soon!
You completed 6 months of preparation. Now it\'s time for practice exams!

Changes are stored on device and apply across the app.
Track your progress, streaks, and achievements
Name will not be included for privacy
Complete tasks to build your streak
This will reset all progress. This action cannot be undone.
This will reset all settings to their defaults. Continue?
Switch between Turkish and English by tapping TR/EN in the header.
Tap any week to expand and see daily tasks. Tap again to collapse.
Tap any task to see detailed instructions and estimated time.
Unable to save weekly goal. Please try again.
Congratulations! You unlocked a new achievement. Great work!
Great! You completed your daily study goal
Don\'t break your %1$d day study streak! Complete a task within the next %2$d hours to keep the streak alive.
Your %1$d day streak expires in %2$d hours
Tap the achievement badge to see your study milestones and keep your motivation high.
Tap the calendar icon to hide, edit, or add your own tasks. All changes are saved on your device.
Adjust your study schedule, start date, and daily time allocations to match your availability.
Create your first task to get started!
Complete tasks to build your streak
Your weekly focus will appear here soon.
Select a Day from the Plan
Tap on any day in the Plan tab to view detailed study materials and tasks

No additional materials for today. Focus on your textbook units!
